OCD.name: Discrete Network Dynamics (DND)
OCD.description: A tool for enumerating the state space of discrete network models.

AD.description: The column name of the functions.
AD.name: Function Label
Node Label
AD.description: The column that holds a label for each node. If provided, the dependency graphs will use this label instead of row numbers.

AD.name: Number of States per Node
AD.description: This represents the number of sates a node can be in.

AD.name: Input Function Format
AD.description: This determines whether the function should be considered Polynomial or Boolean.

AD.name: Updating Scheme
AD.description: Select whether you will update functions in a Synchronous or Sequential manner.
If you have chose sequential updating, specify the update Schedule separated by spaces. Use each number 1...N, where N is number of Nodes, once.
AD.name: Enter update schedule separated by space

AD.description: Choose whether to generate all trajectories from all possible initial conditions or to generate a single trajectory from a given state space.
AD.name: State Space Specification

AD.description: If a single trajectory is selected, specify the initial condition to evaluate separated by spaces. There should be N numbers 0...K-1, where N is the number of nodes and K is the number of states per node.
AD.name: Enter Initial Condition to Evaluate
